messages.title: For the many, not the few.
messages.content: On 8 June, families in Old Bexley & Sidcup can choose between a Labour government that stands up for the many, or the Tories who only look after a privileged few.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protect living standards and create jobs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Introduce a real living wage of £10 per hour and invest in infrastructure, skills and new technology to create jobs.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Defend our NHS and tackle the care crisis
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Give the NHS the social care services they need to help join up services from hospital to home to achieve their potential.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Give all children a great start
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Provide universal free school meals for primary school children and reduce class sizes.
Recruit frontline police in your area and stronger safeguards for victims.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Build affordable homes to rent and buy
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promote more affordable new homes for rent and buy, ending right to buy for private renters.

issues.economy: Introduce a real living wage of £10 per hour and invest in infrastructure, skills and new technology.
issues.education: Provide universal free school meals for primary school children and reduce class sizes.
issues.health: Give the NHS the social care services they need to help join up services from hospital to home.

housing.content: Promote more affordable new homes for rent and buy, ending right to buy for private renters.

leaflet.personalStatement: Danny works hard as a Labour Councillor on Bexley Council, speaking up for all residents.

endorsements.endorsement: I am proud to back Danny Hackett as a strong local voice for Old Bexley & Sidcup. The Tories are holding our country back. Only Labour will build a Britain for the many.

images.caption: Danny Hackett standing up for families in Old Bexley & Sidcup
Danny Hackett standing up for Old Bexley & Sidcup
